meanings.definition: To obtain goods or services from within a company rather than from an external source.
meanings.sent1: The company insources its IT support to save money.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to insource certain tasks to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The boss joked that he would insource all the coffee-making to the employees.
meanings.sent4: Insourcing the production of their products helped the company maintain quality control.
meanings.sent5: Insourcing can lead to better communication among different departments.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing in work or processes from an external source to be completed within a company.
meanings.sent1: Insources can sometimes lead to conflicts between departments.
meanings.sent2: The insources of new projects have brought fresh ideas to the company.
meanings.sent3: The insources of office supplies were delayed due to a shipping error.
meanings.sent4: The insources of creativity from external consultants sparked innovation within the team.
meanings.sent5: The company's success was attributed to its effective insources of talent.
